messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

Please revert the fragment change. I tested the link with the latest godoc version. If it's broken at tip.golang.org then that's a separate issue. On 8 Apr 2013 11:47, wrote: > Reviewers: golang-dev1, > > Message: > Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, > > I'd like you to review this change to > https://code.google.com/p/go/ > > > Description: > doc: fix typos in go1.1.html > > Please review this at https://codereview.appspot.**com/8488047/ > > Affected files: > M doc/go1.1.html > > > Index: doc/go1.1.html > ==============================**==============================**======= > --- a/doc/go1.1.html > +++ b/doc/go1.1.html > @@ -406,9 +406,9 @@ >

Build constraints

> >

> -The "go1.1" tag has been added to the list of default > -build constraints. > -This permits packages to take advanage of the new features in Go 1.1 while > +The "go1.1" tag has been added to the list of default > +build constraints. > +This permits packages to take advantage of the new features in Go 1.1 > while > remaining compatible with earlier versions of Go. >

> > > > -- > > ---You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google > Groups "golang-dev" group. > To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an > email to golang-dev+unsubscribe@**googlegroups.com > . > For more options, visit https://groups.google.com/**groups/opt_out > . > > >

On 2013/04/08 01:51:13, adg1 wrote:
> Please revert the fragment change. I tested the link with the latest godoc
> version. If it's broken at http://tip.golang.org then that's a separate issue.

Done. It is broken on http://tip.golang.org, but I don't know anything about how that works.

It's just using an old version of godoc that uses different templates to
generate the anchors.
On 8 Apr 2013 11:54, <jonathan@titanous.com> wrote:

> On 2013/04/08 01:51:13, adg1 wrote:
>
>> Please revert the fragment change. I tested the link with the latest
>>
> godoc
>
>> version. If it's broken at http://tip.golang.org then that's a
>>
> separate issue.
>
> Done. It is broken on http://tip.golang.org, but I don't know anything
> about how that works.
>
> https://codereview.appspot.**com/8488047/<https://codereview.appspot.com/8488047/>
>

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=e01b476a692a ***

doc: fix typos in go1.1.html

R=golang-dev, adg, adg
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/8488047

Committer: Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org>

subject: code review 8488047: doc: fix typos in go1.1.html
